TABLE.ENUM_OPEN() Syntax Table_List as C = TABLE.ENUM_OPEN( [ Format as C ] ) ArgumentDescription Table_ListA character string containing information about open tables. FormatOptional.
"N" = Table name.
"F" = Path and filename.
"S" = Handle
Description The TABLE.ENUM_OPEN() method returns a character string containing information about open tables. Examples The following script returns a list of open tables. ? table.enum_open("F"+crlf()) = C:\PROGRAM FILES\A5V6\A_CASE.DBF C:\PROGRAM FILES\A5V6\A_GLOSS.DBF C:\PROGRAM FILES\A5V6\NULL.DBF C:\PROGRAM FILES\A5V6\NULL.DBF C:\DATABASES\ALPHASPORTS\CUSTOMER.DBF
The following script closes one of the tables in this list. dim tbl as P tbl = table. get("C:\DATABASES\ALPHASPORTS\CUSTOMER.DBF") tbl.close()
See Also Table Functions and Methods, TABLE.ENUM_SESSION_OPEN()
